enclose verb [T]
(SURROUND)
C1 to surround something: The park that encloses the monument has recently been enlarged.
More examplesFewer examplesThe vertebral column encloses the spinal cord.The house has a small backyard, enclosed by a high brick wall.With the ring enclosed tightly in his hand, he stood deep in thought.The box could once have enclosed important letters or keepsakes.The new classrooms have been built enclosing a small central courtyard.
